alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; Hughes; Lincoln; McClain; Oklahoma; Pontotoc; Pottawatomie; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 26 at 9:54PM CST until February 26 at 10:15PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM CST FOR SEMINOLE...SOUTHEASTERN OKLAHOMA...LINCOLN...EASTERN CLEVELAND... NORTHERN PONTOTOC...POTTAWATOMIE...HUGHES AND SOUTHEASTERN MCCLAIN COUNTIES... At 953 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Davenport to 4 miles southeast of St. Louis, moving east at 70 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Southeastern Oklahoma City, eastern Norman, Shawnee, Seminole, Tecumseh, Holdenville, Chandler, Harrah, McLoud, Wewoka, Stroud, Prague, Pink, Konawa, Wetumka, Byng, Meeker, Maud, Davenport and Wellston. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A tornado watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is an EXTREMELY DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage across central Oklahoma. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.

area.areaDesc: Cleveland; Hughes; Lincoln; McClain; Oklahoma; Pontotoc; Pottawatomie; Seminole
